definition: Amun, deity in Egyptian mythology, also spelled Amon, Amoun, Amen, and rarely Imen
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat
General Lü Meng 呂蒙|吕蒙 of the southern state of Wu (idiom); model of self-improvement by diligent study (from unlettered soldier to top strategist of Wu)

sentences.english: Before I return to the Halls of Amenti.
sentences.chinese: 在我回到阿蒙提大厅之前。

sentences.english: In he was known as Amun.
sentences.chinese: 在古埃及时代，他也被称为阿蒙神。

sentences.english: Guard ye the entrance to the Halls of Amenti.
sentences.chinese: 守护进入阿蒙提大厅入口。

sentences.english: What can prove you are the child of Amon?
sentences.chinese: 什么能够证明你是阿蒙神的孩子？

sentences.english: Amen was also invoked at the end of every prayer.
sentences.chinese: 阿蒙也在每个祈祷结束时使用。

sentences.english: All power and wealth is stripped from the Amun priesthood, and the Aten reigns supreme.
sentences.chinese: 阿蒙祭司的权力和财富皆被剥夺，阿吞神主宰了一切。

sentences.english: The man who sells me wine said he had a rare barrel of Amontillado wine.
sentences.chinese: 一个卖我酒的人说他有整整一桶阿蒙帝来多酒。

sentences.english: Climate change is warming the Amundsen Sea, which is at the southernmargin of the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 太平洋南部的阿蒙森海域气候正在变暖。

sentences.english: Clearly the revered Amun was smiling on his chosen one.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，尊敬的阿蒙大神正眷顾着他的神选者。

sentences.english: Like other great explorers, Amundsen knew when to turn back.
sentences.chinese: 像其他伟大的探险家一样，阿蒙森知道何时退缩。

sentences.english: Now I depart thee to dwell in Amenti.
sentences.chinese: 现在我离开你去居住在阿蒙提。

sentences.english: At home he enlarged the temple of Amon at Karnak .
sentences.chinese: 在国内，他扩建了凯尔奈克的阿蒙神庙。

definition: Poseidon, God of the sea in Greek mythology
Lucifer (Satan's name before his fall in Jewish and Christian mythology)
Logue or Rogge (name)/Jacques Rogge, president of International Olympic Committee (IOC)
écu (French coin, discontinued by the end of the 18th century)
